DataElement.preferredName: Cardiac Disease Assessment Uncertain Diagnosis Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status of a cardiac disease assessment where the diagnosis is uncertain based on the New York Heart Association.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the cardiac disease assessment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the heart.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the status of a cardiac disease assessment where the diagnosis is uncertain based on the New York Heart Association.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: reasonable uncertainty that the symptoms or signs are not of cardiac origin

ValueMeaning.preferredName: reasonable uncertainty that the symptoms or signs are not of cardiac origin
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: reasonable uncertainty that the symptoms or signs are not of cardiac origin

PermissibleValues.value: No Heart Disease: Predisposing Etiologic Factor
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: includes patients in whom no cardiac disease is evident but whose course should be followed by periodic examinations because of a history of an etiologic factor that might cause heart disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: includes patients in whom no cardiac disease is evident but whose course should be followed by periodic examinations because of a history of an etiologic factor that might cause heart disease.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: includes patients in whom no cardiac disease is evident but whose course should be followed by periodic examinations because of a history of an etiologic factor that might cause heart disease.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: includes patients with symptoms or signs referable to the heart but in whom a diagnosis of cardiac disease is uncertain at the time of examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: includes patients with symptoms or signs referable to the heart but in whom a diagnosis of cardiac disease is uncertain at the time of examination.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: includes patients with symptoms or signs referable to the heart but in whom a diagnosis of cardiac disease is uncertain at the time of examination.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Status; a condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ReferenceDocuments.name: 1-COMMENT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Reference: The Criteria Committee of the New York Heart Association. Nomenclature and Criteria for Diagnosis of Diseases of the Heart and Great Vessels. 9th ed. Boston, Mass: Little, Brown & Co; 1994:253-256.
